meanings.definition: To be in a state of frowsting (verb)
meanings.sent1: After playing outside in the rain, the children came inside frowsting with wet clothes.
meanings.sent2: She could feel herself frowsting in the stuffy room with no fresh air.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be frowsting in the sunbeam, refusing to move an inch.
meanings.sent4: The old books in the attic were frowsting away, untouched for years.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned house was frowsting with memories of the past, lingering in the air.

meanings.sent1: The frowsting of the damp towels left a musty smell in the laundry room.
meanings.sent2: The frowsting of the old cheese made the whole kitchen smell unpleasant.
meanings.sent3: The frowsting of the crowded bus made everyone eager to get off at the next stop.
meanings.sent4: The frowsting of the forgotten leftovers in the fridge was a sign it was time for a clean-out.
meanings.sent5: The frowsting of the attic revealed hidden treasures among the dust and cobwebs.
